articles.title: April Spring People's Art Festival Opens
articles.content:
April Spring People's Art Festival Opens
Pyongyang, April 11 (KCNA) -- The Second April Spring People's Art Festival was opened with due ceremony at the People's Palace of Culture in Pyongyang on Sunday.
					The festival brought together professional artistes of nearly 70 art troupes, overseas Korean artistes, members of art squads and itinerant art squads and other working people.
					
					Present at the opening ceremony were Yang Hyong Sop, Kim Jung Rin and Kim Ki Nam, Vice-Premier of the Cabinet O Su Yong, Minister of Culture An Tong Chun who doubles as chairman of the Festival Organizing Committee, officials concerned, artistes and working people.
					
					Screened on the background of the stage were historic scenes showing the immortal exploits of President Kim Il Sung and General Secreatry Kim Jong Il who devoted their all for the development of Juche-based arts.
					
					An Tong Chun said in an opening address that the festival would prove to be a significant one where its participants would enthusiastically sing songs lauding the sun, reflecting the ardent yarning of the Korean people for President Kim Il Sung and boundless national honor and pride of holding the peerless great man in high esteem.
					
					He referred to the fact that Kim Jong Il, possessed of the noble sense of moral obligation towards the President, provided the April Spring People's Art Festival, realizing the wishes of the Korean people to sing songs praising the great man for all ages and wisely leading the work to ensure that the festival is held with splendor. 
					
					He expressed the belief that the festival would add to the people's joy of commemorating the Day of the Sun and contribute to stirring up the festive atmosphere of April.
					
					Then followed an art performance.

articles.title: Mangyongdae Prize Marathon Held
articles.content:
Mangyongdae Prize Marathon Held
 Pyongyang, April 11 (KCNA) -- IAAF-the 23rd Mangyongdae Prize Marathon took place here on the occasion of the Day of the Sun.
					 An opening ceremony of the marathon was held at the Kim Il Sung Stadium on Sunday. 
					
					 Present there were Kim Jung Rin, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Tong Jong Ho, minister of Construction and Building Materials Industry who doubles as chairman of the DPRK Marathon Association, officials concerned and working people in the city.
					
					 On hand were athletes of the DPRK, China, Zimbabwe, Ukraine, Kenya, South Africa, Ethiopia and Namibia.
					
					 Pak Hak Son, chairman of the Physical Culture and Sports Guidance Commission, made an address at the ceremony.
					
					 He expressed the belief that the marathon would mark an important occasion in significantly commemorating the Day of the Sun, jointly developing marathon technique and deepen friendship among various countries of the world.
					
					 At the marathon which brought together more than 700 runners Ukrainian Babaryka Ivan and Korean woman Kim Kum Ok came first and Koreans Pak Song Chol and Jong Yong Ok placed second and Ri Yong Ho and Kim Mi Gyong third.
					
					 Cups, medals and certificates were awarded to the successful runners at the closing ceremony.

articles.title: Chinese Guests Arrive for Kimilsungia Festival
articles.content:
Chinese Guests Arrive for Kimilsungia Festival
 Pyongyang, April 11 (KCNA) -- Chinese delegations and figures arrived here Sunday by train to participate in the 12th Kimilsungia Festival.
					 They are a delegation of the Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Greenhouse in Dandong headed by its General Manager Wang Dongping, the managing director of the Shenyang Korean Economic and Trade Investment Consultative Co. Ltd and his party and the Chinese Regional Delegation of the Association for Supporting the Propagation of Immortal Flowers.

articles.title: S. Korea Urged to Stop War Aggression against North
articles.content:
S. Korea Urged to Stop War Aggression against North
 Pyongyang, April 11 (KCNA) -- The chief executive of south Korea was recently reported to have kicked up war atmosphere, instructing the warmongers of the military to "get fully ready for any event." His minions let loose a whole string of dangerous war outbursts, trumpeting about the non-existent "threat" and "provocation" from someone. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Sunday observes in a signed article in this regard:
					
					 The above-said outpourings of the south Korean ruling quarters are unpardonable acts of treachery as they threaten the destiny of the nation and disturb peace of the country and rash acts of going against the trend of the times towards independent reunification, peace and prosperity. 
					
					 The danger of a nuclear war is increasing on the Korean Peninsula day by day and the inter-Korean relations are inching close to an unpredictable collapse due to the reckless moves of the group of traitors to provoke a war.
					
					 The south Korean ruling quarters are persistently rushing headlong into the moves for a war of aggression against the north, challenging the ardent desire of the Koreans for peaceful reunification. This is absolutely intolerable as it is the greatest treason of letting the country and the nation fall victim to a nuclear war to be started by foreign forces.
					
					 Their reckless remarks are nothing but a replica of the call for achieving "unification by prevailing over communism" made by the successive anti-reunification elements of south Korea. The present ruling quarters of south Korea are getting frantic in the moves to escalate the confrontation and ignite a war, retrieving the dregs of history which had been thrown into its dumping ground after being cursed and denounced by the whole nation.
					
					 This is a blatant challenge of the outdated forces intended to block the advance of the June 15 era of reunification and bring back the last era of confrontation in a bid to prolong their remaining days.
					
					 The anti-reunification conservative forces are now going mad with the moves to start a war of aggression against the north in collusion with outsiders, but this is nothing but the last-ditch effort of those who have lived out their days.

articles.title: S. Korea Wholly to Blame for Derailing Mt. Kumgang Tour
articles.content:
S. Korea Wholly to Blame for Derailing Mt. Kumgang Tour
 Pyongyang, April 11 (KCNA) -- The measure taken on April 8 by the General Guidance Bureau for the Development of Scenic Spots of the DPRK as regards the issue of tour of Mt. Kumgang is the inevitable consequence entailed by the moves of the south Korean authorities to escalate the confrontation with fellow countrymen.
					 Minju Joson Sunday observes this in a signed commentary.
					
					 The commentary goes on:
					
					 The south Korean authorities should have reflected and apologized for their criminal acts. But they let the "Ministry of Unification" talk nonsense that "the responsibility for the deplorable situation entirely rests with the north side," terming the just measure of the DPRK's side "violation" of the "contract between businessmen" and "agreement between authorities." This is like a thief crying "Stop the thief!"
					
					 The commentary cites facts to prove that the conservative group has run the whole gamut of cynical ploys to scuttle the tour of Mt. Kumgang ever since Hyundai Group concluded a contract on the above-said tourism with the DPRK side.
					
					 The conservative group overturned the agreement reached between the Korea Asia-Pacific Peace Committee and Hyundai Group last summer to resume the suspended tour as early as possible, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 Great irony is that the conservative group is now raising a hue and cry over the "violation of the agreement between authorities".
					
					 This group dares charge the other side with "the violation of the agreement between authorities" though it brought the tour to a suspension by perpetrating such act of treachery as totally denying the inter-Korean joint declarations supported even by the UN and other international organizations and blocked its resumption. It is the height of arrogance.
					
					 It is the ulterior intention of the south Korean puppet group to justify the criminal action taken by it to derail the tour and lay the blame for it at the north side's door by misleading public opinion.
					
					 If the south Korean authorities persist in the above-said rash acts, they will have to pay a dear price for them.

articles.title: Sycophancy towards Japan Flayed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Sycophancy towards Japan Flayed in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, April 11 (KCNA) -- The Citizens Council for Supporting the Grand Mothers of the "Volunteers Corps" and other civic and public organizations in south Korea at a press conference held in Seoul on April 7 denounced the puppet authorities for their humiliating sycophancy towards Japan.
					 Speakers at the press conference accused the Japanese government of refusing to page wages, allowances, etc. to the Korean workers who were taken to Japan for forcible conscription during the Japanese imperialists' rule under the pretext of the south Korea-Japan "agreement" signed in 1965. What is more deplorable is the fact that the south Korean authorities are asserting that they would pay them in the form of "aid" in place of Japan, they noted.
					
					 Querying the authorities why they should replace Japan and pay them with taxes collected from the people, the victim, though the assailant should be responsible for them, they declared that this was a product of the humiliating diplomacy pursued by them towards Japan, discarding even the dignity of the nation.
					
					 They demanded the authorities stop at once the act of patronizing Japan and force it to pay due reparation for the damage done by the Japanese imperialists.

articles.title: Blocking Joint Event of Women Accused in S. Korea
articles.content:
Blocking Joint Event of Women Accused in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, April 11 (KCNA) -- The Council for the Solution of the Issue of the Volunteers' Corps and other women's organizations in south Korea at a press conference held  in Seoul on April 7 strongly protested against the attitude of the puppet Ministry of Unification blocking the joint event of inter-Korean women for forcing Japan to redress its past history.
					 The organizations recalled at the press conference that the ministry is standing in the way of holding a seminar of inter-Korean women for the solution to the issue of the "comfort women" for the Imperial Japanese Army under the unreasonable pretext of "concern about personal safety", adding that this clearly indicates the stand of the authorities not to seek a true solution to the issue related to "comfort women".
					
					 The seminar is not a simple joint event but an event to bring about a decisive phase in the efforts to find a solution to the issue this year, they said, stressing that in the light of the present inter-Korean relations the ministry should positively support the joint event and contribute to making a breakthrough towards improving the inter-Korean relations.
					
					 The organizations demanded the authorities positively opt for ensuring the above-said joint event, though belatedly.

articles.title: Bangladeshi Party Leaders Release Joint Statement
articles.content:
Bangladeshi Party Leaders Release Joint Statement
Pyongyang, April 11 (KCNA) -- Rashed Khan Menon, chairman of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Bangladesh, and Hasanul Huq Inu, chairman of the Central Executive Committee of the Bangladesh National Socialist Party, released a joint statement on April 5 on the occasions of the Day of the Sun and the 17th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's election as chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission.
					 President Kim Il Sung founded the immortal Juche idea, clearly indicating the road to be followed by humankind and translating into a reality the desire of the Korean people to live in a new world free from all sorts of exploitation and oppression, the statement said, adding that this instilled stronger confidence and courage into the world progressives in their struggle to build a new society.
					
					 It noted the Songun politics pursued by Kim Jong Il has helped firmly defend socialist Korea from the moves of the imperialists for aggression and encouraged the progressive people in their efforts to live in a new independent world.
					
					 Expressing firm belief that the Korean people would wage a dynamic drive for building a thriving socialist nation and achieving the independent and peaceful reunification of the country under his outstanding Songun leadership, the statement reiterated their will to invariably support the Korean people in their just cause.

articles.title: Day of Sun Commemorated in China, Russia
articles.content:
Day of Sun Commemorated in China, Russia
						
 Pyongyang, April 11 (KCNA) -- Round-table talks took place in China on April 9 on the occasion of the Day of the Sun.
					 Present there were officials of the China Association for International Friendly Contact and the Beijing Association for International Friendly Contact and families of those related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle.
					
					 The participants watched Korean film "Fireworks for a Thriving Nation".
					
					 Speeches were made by the vice-president of the China Association for International Friendly Contact, a family member related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle and others at the round-table talks.
					
					 The speakers recollected that President Kim Il Sung not only put an end to the colonial rule of the Japanese imperialists and beat back the U.S. imperialists' aggression but also devoted his whole life to the Korean people's cause of national liberation and socialist revolution and construction, the independent and peaceful reunification of the country and global independence.
					
					 A remembrance meeting of families of those related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle was held at the DPRK embassy in Beijing on April 8.
					
					 Speeches were made by a son of Li Zade, an anti-Japanese revolutionary fighter, Zhang Jinlu, a daughter of Zhang Weihua, an anti-Japanese revolutionary martyr, Feng Yila, a daughter of Feng Zhongyun, a person related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle, Shang Jialan, a daughter of Shang Yue, a person related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle, and a daughter of Liu Hanxing, a person related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle.
					
					 They remembered with deep emotion that the President performed the undying feats for the Sino-DPRK friendship and unsparingly showed paternal loving care for them, the descendants of the comrades-in-arms who fought alongside him during the past anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle.
					
					 A meeting was held in Russia on April 8 to commemorate the Day of the Sun.
					
					 Displayed in the venue of the meeting were works of the President and Kim Jong Il and books introducing the undying feats of the three commanders of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 Present there were representatives and members of the All-Union Communist Party of Bolsheviks and other political parties, officials of the Russian Association for Friendship and Cultural Cooperation with the DPRK and masses.
					
					 Speakers at the meeting highly praised the undying feats the President performed for the Korean revolution and the human cause of independence.
					
					 Messages to Kim Jong Il were adopted at the meeting.

articles.title: Day of Sun Commemorated in Spain
articles.content:
Day of Sun Commemorated in Spain
 Pyongyang, April 11 (KCNA) -- An internet book and photo exhibition on the theme of "President Kim Il Sung is always remembered by humankind" was held in Spain from Mar. 13 to 31.
					 The Preparatory Committee of the Korean Friendship Association for Commemorating the Centenary of Birth of the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung arranged a special page for the exhibition on the internet homepage of the association which has a main page and subsidiary pages.
					
					 Seen on the main page were a portrait of smiling President Kim Il Sung and a photo of the flag of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea and an article of the preparatory committee dedicated to the day.
					
					 The article noted that Kim Il Sung had performed undying feats which no great man in the world could ever do, holding high the banner of independence since he embarked on the road of the struggle for national liberation in his teens, shouldering upon himself the destiny of the country and the nation.
					
					The sacred cause of Kim Il Sung has been steadfastly carried forward by General Secretary Kim Jong Il and socialist Korea is shedding its rays as the homeland of Songun and a beacon of hope for the progressives, added the article.
					
					 Posted on the subsidiary pages were books and photos on the revolutionary careers and exploits of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il and Kim Jong Suk, anti-Japanese heroine, and their personalities and the reminiscences "With the Century" and works of the peerlessly great men.
					
					 Photos, Korean films and music dealing with the struggle of the Korean people were also posted on the pages.
					
					 The special page was read by more than 4.37 million people of the world.
					
					 In the meantime, Alejandro Cao de Benos, chairman of the Korean Friendship Association headquartered in Spain, sent a letter to Kim Jong Il in connection with the successful holding of the exhibition.
					
					 The letter said Kim Il Sung was a prominent leader of the 20th century and the greatest man revered by the world progressives, expressing conviction that the Korean people would fling open the gate to a great prosperous and powerful nation in 2012 without fail under the outstanding leadership of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Centenary of Kim Il Sung's Birth to Be Commemorated in Japan
articles.content:
Centenary of Kim Il Sung's Birth to Be Commemorated in Japan
 Pyongyang, April 11 (KCNA) -- The Toyama Prefectural Preparatory Committee for Commemorating the Centenary of Birth of President Kim Il Sung was inaugurated in Japan.
					 Writer Noboru Kameda, representative of the Society of the Japan-Korea Culture, was elected representative of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The preparatory committee decided to publish a collection of words of songs and hold a photo exhibition and various other events on the occasion of the centenary of birth of the President.
